avalancheActivity.highlights: The snow is settling in the tawing and gaining strength

snowpackStructure.highlights: Thaw Monday 26.2. affected the snowpack up to ridges and a significant amount of snow was melted. The snowpack became isotherm and refroze again. A little snow has been added since then, and the small wind slabs that may have formed are belived to gone wet and well bounded

travelAdvisory.highlights: Warming across the country since Monday has resulted in numerous avalanches . Cooling weather is expected over the weekend and the snowpack will strengthen as a result of freeze-thaw cycles.

weatherForecast.highlights: SA-lægar áttir og skúrir en kólnar og birti á laugard.

avalancheActivity.comment: Several rather small avalanches released in the forecasting area after rising temperatures on Monday, 4th March. A slab avalanche released in Skálavík Sunday March 3rd. Multiple small loose avalanches fell on a thin layer after sun exposure last weekend in Seljalandsdalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Several avalanches released in the forecasting area in thaw on Monday, March 4th. Layered snowpack in the area and possible windslabs in S and W aspects. Snow becoming more stable in cooling weather.

snowpackStructure.highlights: : A Snowpit at 590 m elevation in Syðridalur in Bolungarvík on Monday 4th march, shows a layered wind packed snow and rain crust. A sudden planar fracture between windslabs at 19 cm with little force, a second fracture was non-planar break between ice layer and windslab at 48 cm depth at CT22. Thin windslabs possible in S- to W- aspects in highest mountains. Older snow considered rather stable. Sun exposure effected the top layers and small avalanches released widely in the forecasting area on Monday with rising temperatures. Stability is considered to increase with cooling temperature.

travelAdvisory.highlights: Warming across the country since Monday has resulted in numerous avalanches . Cooling weather is expected over the weekend and the snowpack will strengthen as a result of freeze-thaw cycles.

weatherForecast.highlights: S- og SA- lægar áttir næstudaga, fremur hvasst á föstudag og einhver rigning um morguninn en mögulega snjókoma í hæstu fjöll. Þurrt, kólnar lítillega og hægari vindur á laugardag og sunnudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Decreased stability in the warming and the strong SE-winds from Sunday night resulting in many middle size slab avalanches. Most of them rather thin with rather short outrun. A slab avalanche released in a steep S face in Upsadalur west of Dalvík on Saturday most likely by a snowmobile, it overran it"s track.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Middle size slabs released yesterday in strong SE-winds and also when the temps started rising on Sunday night. Sowpits from Siglufjörður showed poor binding of the wind slab to the firn below last weekend but the snowpack is belived to be gaining strength in the thawing

snowpackStructure.highlights: Unstable wind slabs might still be present at higher elevations after northerly winds with snow from Friday and strong SE-winds from Sunday night. A high temp. gradient were in the snowpack last week. Stability tests last weekend showed sudden planar failure in the slab with very light load at the border to the old firn where facits have developed. This weakness could be deeper some places. Highly decreased stability in the warming and the strong SE-winds resulted in many slab releases on Monday but the stability is assumed to be increasing again

travelAdvisory.highlights: Warming across the country since Monday has resulted in numerous avalanches . Cooling weather is expected over the weekend and the snowpack will strengthen as a result of freeze-thaw cycles.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg átt og kólnar heldur um helgina

avalancheActivity.comment: Rather small slab avalanches released 6th March due to solar radiation in highest mountains in Fjarðarheiði and around Seyðisfjörður. When temperature rose on Monday several avalanches released in the forecasting area. Off piste skiers triggered three slab avalanches on March 2nd, both in Stafdalur and Oddsskarð.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has become wet and subsided in the last few days in thaw and rain. Unstable windslabs can be found in highest mountains. Skiers triggered avalanches last weekend and many natural avalanches released during the week. Snow is becoming more stable in colder weather.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Unstable windslabs can persist in high elevations, rather thin in most places but can be thicker in gullies. Below 700 m elevation snow has become wet in thaw and rain in the last few days. Older snow is considered more stable. Some layering persists in the snowpack, as seen in a snowpit in Oddsskarð March 5th, with BRK fracture at CT11. Snow is becoming more stable in colder weather.

travelAdvisory.highlights: Warming across the country since Monday has resulted in numerous avalanches . Cooling weather is expected over the weekend and the snowpack will strengthen as a result of freeze-thaw cycles.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðaustan og sunnan áttir næstu daga, og stöku skúrir eða él. Kólnandi veður.
